member.name: M:Beamable.Spoons.Program.Main
member.summary: The entry point for the service.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.temperature
member.summary: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.top_p
member.summary: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.n
member.summary: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.stop
member.summary: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.max_tokens
member.summary: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the chat completion. The total length of input tokens and generated tokens is limited by the model's context length.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.frequency_penalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

member.name: F:Beamable.Spoons.Services.OpenAI.ChatGpt3_5TurboRequest.presence_penalty
member.summary: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
